# Question 1



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
unemp_house_prices <- read_csv(
  'https://bcdanl.github.io/data/unemp_house_prices.csv')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 25704 Columns: 5
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): state
dbl  (3): unemploy_perc, house_price_index, house_price_perc
date (1): date

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#| fig-height: 9

unemp_house_prices |> 
  filter(year(date) >= 2008) |> 
  ggplot(aes(x=date , y = unemploy_perc/100)) +
  geom_line(color='black') +
  geom_area(fill = 'lightblue') +
  facet_geo(~ state) +
  scale_x_date(breaks = '2 years',
               labels = date_format('%y')) +
  scale_y_percent() +
  labs(title = "",
    x = "",
    y = "Unemployment Rate (%)") +
  theme(strip.text.x = element_text(size = 6),
        axis.text.x = element_text(size = rel(.75)))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](homework_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
